page.title: 13HOUSING (CONT)
page.content: 2.{Pilgrim's Way & Mount Road.} 85% of the houses were built in the postwar period with the remainder of inter-war construction. 75% were semi-detached, 15% detached & 10% terraced. In this area the gardens were more spacious & the density of housing significantly lower than in Spring Lane. The houses were well-maintained- the paintwork & exterior were generally impressive. It was noticeable that many properties had been improved by the addition of extensions, new wall-facades, windows & even roofs. Some residents complained, however, about the absence of open space & the danger to school-children caused by crossing the A2. As this estate has expanded outwards, some encroachment on to valuable orchard land has been unavoidable.
